intro: Bonnetia duidae, commonly known as the Hawaiian bonnetia, is a flowering plant native to the Hawaiian Islands. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family, which includes coffee and gardenias. The plant is characterized by its small, clustered white or pink flowers and narrow, leathery leaves. It typically grows in moist, shaded environments such as forests and rocky areas. Bonnetia duidae plays a role in the ecological diversity of Hawaii's unique flora.
